"I'm Only Human, Not God": PM Modi In Podcast Debut With Zerodha Chief Nikhil Kamath - NDTV
summary:
I'm Only Human, Not God: PM Modi In Podcast Debut With Zerodha Chief Nikhil Kamath

Publication Date: New Delhi

Source: News Article

In his debut podcast appearance on Zerodha co-founder Nikhil Kamath's show, Prime Minister Narendra Modi acknowledged his flaws, stating, 'I too can make mistakes.' He comforted Kamath over his Hindi skills, emphasizing their shared understanding.

  • Prime Minister Modi discusses his humanity and the inevitability of mistakes.
  • Nikhil Kamath expresses concerns about his language skills due to his South Indian background.
  • The podcast covers Modi’s childhood, education, and challenges faced in politics.
  • PM Modi actively engages with Kamath, making the dialogue personal and relatable.
  • Modi shared a light-hearted anecdote about his childhood chores.
'Mistakes happen, and I too can make some. I am also a human, not god.' - PM Modi

Modi shared a heartfelt message with listeners, hoping they enjoyed the podcast as much as he did creating it.
newTitle: Prime Minister Modi Reflects on Human Experience in Podcast Debut

Pune BPO accountant’s murder: Video shows attacker with cleaver in office parking lot, being nabbed after attack - The Indian Express
PM Narendra Modi makes podcast debut with Zerodha's Nikhil Kamath: Watch - Hindustan Times
summary:
PM Narendra Modi makes podcast debut with Zerodha's Nikhil Kamath: 'I am not a God'

Date: Jan 10, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

In his first podcast, PM Narendra Modi discusses integrity in politics and reflects on his past mistakes.

  • PM Narendra Modi acknowledged his podcast debut, responding, “This is my first podcast, I don't know how it'll go with your audience.”
  • Modi reflected on a previous speech from his tenure as Gujarat's chief minister, stating, “I said something in an insensitive way. Mistakes happen. I am human, not a God.”
  • “My first wish when I became CM was to invite all my school friends to CM House,” said PM Modi.
  • “I used to wash the clothes of all my family members. Because of that, I was allowed to go to the pond,” Modi on his childhood.
  • “One should enter politics with a mission, not with ambition,” Modi said.
“Mistakes happen. I am human, not a God.” - PM Narendra Modi

This podcast marks a significant moment for PM Modi as he shares insights and encourages integrity and mission-driven participation in politics.
newTitle: PM Narendra Modi makes podcast debut with Zerodha's Nikhil Kamath: 'I am not a God'

title: Class 3 female student of Zebar School in Thaltej dies of suspected cardiac arrest - DeshGujarat
summary:
Class 3 female student of Zebar School in Thaltej dies of suspected cardiac arrest

Date: Today
Source: DeshGujarat

In a tragic incident, a class 3 student at Zebar School for Children, Thaltej, has died after complaining of chest pain.

  • The student, Gargi Ranpara, was around 8-9 years old.
  • She arrived at school at 7:30 AM and collapsed on the stairs after complaining of chest pain.
  • The school staff performed CPR but could not revive her.
  • She was rushed to a nearby hospital, where she was declared dead.
  • Preliminary reports indicate cardiac arrest as the cause of death.
  • The school administration confirmed that Gargi had no prior history of cardiac issues.
  • The police are reviewing CCTV footage as part of their investigation.
“The cardiac arrest was sad and sudden,” stated the school’s administration.

This heartbreaking event has raised concerns about the health monitoring of students in schools.
newTitle: Tragic Incident: Class 3 Student Dies of Suspected Cardiac Arrest at Zebar School

title: Coldplay Concert: Bombay High Court Dismisses PIL Seeking Guidelines On Ticket Scalping - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Coldplay Concert: Bombay High Court Dismisses PIL Seeking Guidelines On Ticket Scalping

Date: 02 January 2024

Source: Live Law

The Bombay High Court has dismissed a Public Interest Litigation concerning ticket scalping and black marketing of concert tickets, stating the issue falls under police jurisdiction.

  • The court found the matter not suitable for judicial scrutiny.
  • Petitioners were advised to pursue other legal remedies such as filing an FIR or a consumer complaint.
  • The PIL addressed irregularities in ticket sales during a recent Coldplay concert on BookMyShow.
  • Petitioners argued that these practices hinder consumer rights and cause economic losses.
“Such practices have deprived consumers of their fundamental right to have equal opportunity of buying tickets and getting access to entertainment and live events.”

The dismissal of the PIL highlights ongoing concerns about ticket scalping and consumer rights in the entertainment sector.
newTitle: Bombay High Court Dismisses PIL on Concert Ticket Scalping

title: Boby Chemmanur moves Kerala High Court for bail in sexual harassment case - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Boby Chemmanur Seeks Bail in Kerala High Court Amid Sexual Harassment Case

Published on: 10 Jan 2025, 7:42 am, Source: Kerala High Court

Businessman Boby Chemmanur has applied for bail in the Kerala High Court following his arrest for a sexual harassment case filed by a Malayalam actress. His initial bail request was denied by a magistrate who found his comments to be inappropriate.

  • Chemmanur was arrested on January 8 and remanded for 14 days after his bail application was rejected.
  • The High Court will hear the case further on January 14, with the judge emphasizing that the case is not considered special.
  • The actress claims Chemmanur made inappropriate comments during a public event, exacerbating online harassment towards her.
  • Chemmanur's legal team argues the allegations are fabricated, pointing out delays in filing the complaint.
  • A key issue discussed was the potential bias of the magistrate who initially refused bail.
“There is no speciality for you. I have to give the prosecution time to get instructions.” – Justice PV Kunhikrishnan

The case raises significant questions about public comments and accountability, reflecting ongoing societal issues surrounding sexual harassment.
newTitle: Boby Chemmanur Seeks Bail in Kerala High Court Amid Sexual Harassment Case

title: BH Registered Vehicles Subject To Motor Vehicle Tax As Per State Law; Centre Can't Prescribe Tax Rates :... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Kerala High Court Ruling on BH Series Vehicle Tax Rates

Publication Date: (Date not provided) Source: Live Law

The Kerala High Court has ruled that the Central Government cannot enforce motor vehicle tax rates for Bharat (BH) registered vehicles, affirming that taxation on vehicles falls under state jurisdiction.

  • The Court held that the Central Government lacks authority to prescribe tax rates for BH vehicles.
  • BH registration was introduced to facilitate seamless transfer of vehicles across states.
  • The judgment responds to petitions from vehicle owners regarding tax payment for BH registration in Kerala.
  • The court specified that while principles for taxation can be set by the Centre, the rates must be determined by the states.
“The Central Government would not have the power to prescribe the rate of tax on motor vehicles,” the Court stated.

In conclusion, the Court emphasized that states can levy their own tax rates based on respective laws for BH registered vehicles, guided by the principles laid out by the Centre.
newTitle: Kerala High Court Ruling on BH Series Vehicle Tax Rates

title: India-Taliban talks: Region in flux and 5 reasons behind Delhi’s decision to engage Kabul - The Indian Express
summary:
India-Taliban Talks: Region in Flux and 5 Reasons Behind Delhi’s Decision to Engage Kabul

Publication Date: January 9, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

The meeting between Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri and Taliban Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi highlights India's approach to navigating complex geopolitical dynamics.

  • The meeting underscores India's national and security interests in the region.
  • No official recognition of the Taliban government is being considered yet.
  • Geopolitical shifts in the region are prompting India to engage cautiously.
  • India's humanitarian and development assistance to Afghanistan remains a facet of the discussions.
  • Ongoing concerns about Afghan security and its implications for India.
“This meeting is an effort by India to secure its own national and security interests with many moving parts in play.”

In conclusion, the talks signal India's strategic approach to a changing political landscape and reflect its ongoing commitment to Afghanistan amidst challenges.
newTitle: India-Taliban Talks: Reasons Behind Delhi’s Engagement with Kabul

Bombay High Court Takes Suo Motu Cognisance On Protection And Preservation Of Wetlands In State - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Bombay High Court Takes Suo Motu Cognisance On Protection And Preservation Of Wetlands In State

Date: 10 January 2025 Source: Live Law

The Bombay High Court has taken suo motu cognisance of the issue of wetlands preservation in Maharashtra, following a directive from the Supreme Court.

  1. The High Court acted based on a Supreme Court order regarding the maintenance of Ramsar Convention sites.
  2. It issued notices to the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change, Union of India, and state's environmental authorities.
  3. Senior Advocate Janak Dwarkadas has been appointed as amicus curiae to assist the Court.
  4. The next hearing is scheduled for 25 February 2025.
“The High Courts could take the assistance of amicus curiae if necessary.”

This action underscores the court's commitment to environmental protection and adherence to international conventions regarding wetlands.
newTitle: Bombay High Court Takes Action on Wetland Preservation

title: Supreme Court disallows puja at Sambhal Jama Masjid's well - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Disallows Puja at Sambhal Jama Masjid's Well

Publication Date: Recent

Source: Legal News

An application from the mosque committee was addressed in court, arguing against the Sambhal District administration's proposal to allow public access to a well near the mosque, which the committee claims is being misrepresented as a historical Hindu site.

  • The mosque committee argued that promoting the well as a site for Hindu prayers could disturb local harmony.
  • Senior Advocate Huzefa Ahmadi presented the case, highlighting concerns over the administration's notice referring to the site as Hari Mandir.
  • The Supreme Court issued an interim order to not give effect to the notice until further review.
  • The Court aims to maintain peace and harmony amidst the brewing dispute.
“Opening the same for Hindu prayers will result in mischief and disturb the fragile harmony and peace in the area at the moment.”

This ruling reflects ongoing tensions in the area and emphasizes the Court's role in pre-emptive measures to maintain public order.
newTitle: Supreme Court Disallows Puja at Sambhal Jama Masjid's Well

Delhi election: Kejriwal offers to sponsor private guards hired by RWAs in latest poll perk - Hindustan Times
summary:
Kejriwal Offers to Sponsor Private Guards Hired by RWAs in Latest Poll Perk

Published on January 10, 2025 by HT News Desk

The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has announced a new initiative aimed at securing support in the upcoming Delhi assembly elections by offering financial support for Resident Welfare Associations (RWAs) to hire private guards.

  • Arvind Kejriwal announced funding for private security for RWAs if AAP wins the elections.
  • This move is part of a broader strategy to counter anti-incumbency sentiments.
  • Additional welfare schemes announced include a ₹2,100 monthly honorarium for women and free healthcare for the elderly.
  • The elections will take place on February 5, with counting on February 8.
“It is a single-phase election... we have deliberately kept polling on a Wednesday so more people come out to vote,” – CEC Rajiv Kumar.

The upcoming election will be crucial for AAP as it seeks a third consecutive term amid increasing competition from BJP and Congress.
newTitle: Kejriwal Promises Security Perk for RWAs in Delhi Elections

title: Go to Modi, not Akal Takht, if you want me to end fast: Dallewal tells Punjab BJP leaders - The Tribune India
summary:
Dallewal Urges BJP Leaders to Approach Modi for Resolution as Fast Enters 46th Day

Publication Date: Friday, Source: The Tribune

Dallewal, whose fast-unto-death entered the 46th day, has called on the Punjab BJP leaders to seek intervention from Prime Minister Modi instead of the Akal Takht.

  • Dallewal is on a hunger strike demanding the acceptance of farmers' demands.
  • He criticized the BJP for approaching the Akal Takht and urged them to contact Modi and other high-ranking officials.
  • The farmer leader has been in protest since November 26 and is receiving medical attention.
  • A high-level medical team is monitoring his health with emergency support readily available at the protest site.
“You should be going to the office of Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar, who has already expressed his concerns on our issue.”

This ongoing protest highlights the tensions between farmers and government authorities, showcasing the need for direct engagement in resolving agricultural disputes.
newTitle: Dallewal Urges BJP Leaders to Approach Modi for Resolution as Fast Enters 46th Day

title: Sambhal Masjid Row | Supreme Court Directs No Action On Notices Which Claim Well Near Mosque As Hindu... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Halts Notices Claiming Well Near Sambhal Mosque as Hindu Temple

Date: January 10, 2025

Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court has issued a stay on notices by Uttar Pradesh authorities regarding a well near the Sambhal mosque that claimed it to be a Hindu temple.

  • The Supreme Court restrained the local authorities from enforcing notices about the well adjacent to the mosque.
  • The Sambhal Shahi Jama Masjid Committee filed a petition challenging a lower court's order for a survey claiming the mosque was built on a demolished temple.
  • Concerns were raised over posters labeling the well as a 'Hari Mandir', with implications for communal harmony in the area.
  • The court ordered that no notices, including the one falsely describing the well, should be acted upon.
  • The situation at the well has been a flashpoint for communal tensions, highlighted by a past incident of violence.
  • The court has directed a status report on the situation and recommended forming a peace committee.
CJI stated, "Keeping a close watch so that peace and harmony is maintained." - Chief Justice of India Sanjiv Khanna

This ruling seeks to prevent the escalation of tensions surrounding religious sites and uphold communal harmony in the region.
newTitle: Supreme Court Halts Notices Claiming Well Near Sambhal Mosque as Hindu Temple

title: JEE Advanced SC verdict: Aspirants who dropped out between Nov 5-18 eligible for three attempts under pre - The Times of India
Lonely at the bottom, INDIA parties with AAP, Congress says ready to step up its Delhi game - The Indian Express
summary:
Congress says no doubt about taking on AAP as INDIA allies rally behind Kejriwal

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Indian Express

The Congress party is facing challenges as its partners within the INDIA bloc increasingly support the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), complicating its approach towards electoral strategy in Delhi.

  • Congress has shifted from aggressive posturing against AAP to exploring potential alliances.
  • AAP's influence in Delhi poses a threat to Congress, which has seen a significant drop in vote share.
  • Congress leaders express a need for clarity on the INDIA bloc's goals beyond parliamentary elections.
  • An aggressive campaign against AAP is being developed by Congress in preparation for upcoming elections.
“Whatever our friends in the INDIA bloc say, it is the AAP that has taken away our votes.” - Senior Congress Leader

This evolving dynamic raises questions about Congress's future strategy and its ability to regain electoral ground in Delhi.
newTitle: Congress and AAP's Complicated Alliance Amidst Election Strategies

title: 'Hamari Adhoori Kahani': UP man posts chilling Facebook post before hanging self, alleges harassment over - The Times of India
summary:
‘Hamari Adhoori Kahani’: UP man posts chilling Facebook post before hanging self, alleges harassment over love marriage

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

A Uttar Pradesh man shared a disturbing Facebook post before taking his own life, claiming harassment related to his love marriage. The post has sparked discussions around mental health and the impacts of societal pressures regarding relationship choices.

  • The man posted allegations of harassment before his death.
  • His suicide raises awareness about the struggles individuals face in love marriages.
  • Incidents like these prompt discussions on mental health, societal norms, and personal freedom.
“It is alarming that societal pressures lead to such tragic outcomes,” commented a mental health advocate.

This tragic incident highlights the dire need for more open discussions around mental health and the societal challenges faced by young couples today.

BEL Probationary Engineer Online Form 2025 Released

Key Points:

  • Application process started on January 10, 2025.

title: Vaikuntha Ekadashi Vrat 2025: Know Date, Parana Timings, Puja Vidhi, Significance and more - Moneycontrol
summary:
Vaikuntha Ekadashi Vrat 2025: Date, Timings, and Significance

Date: January 10, 2025

Source: Moneycontrol

Vaikuntha Ekadashi, dedicated to Lord Vishnu, will be observed on January 10, 2025. This day is vital for devotees seeking spiritual salvation.

  • Vrat Date: January 10, 2025
  • Parana Time: 07:15 to 08:21, January 11
  • Dwadashi End Moment: 08:21, January 11
  • Observance Details: Fasting is believed to open the gates to Vaikuntha, leading to salvation.
  • Variability: Depending on lunar calculations, there may be none, one, or twos Vaikuntha Ekadashis in a year.
"The observance of Vaikuntha Ekadashi opens the gates to heaven for devotees who fast with dedication."

In conclusion, Vaikuntha Ekadashi Vrat offers a sacred opportunity for devotion and renewal of spiritual practices.
newTitle: Vaikuntha Ekadashi Vrat 2025: Date, Timings, and Significance

title: AIIMS opens recruitment for 4000+ non-faculty positions across India - Greater Kashmir
summary:
AIIMS Opens Recruitment for 4000+ Non-Faculty Positions Across India

Date: Not specified
Source: All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS)

The All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) has launched a recruitment drive for over 4,000 Non-Faculty Group-B and Group-C positions. Applications can be submitted through the official AIIMS website until January 31, 2025.

  • Application Process: Opened on January 7, 2025; closes on January 31, 2025, at 5:00 PM.
  • How to Apply: Submit applications online via the official AIIMS website.
  • Vacancies: Roles available include Assistant Dieticians, Data Entry Operators, Medical Lab Technologists, and Pharmacists.
  • Examination Mode: Computer-Based Test (CBT), scheduled for February 26 to 28, 2025.
  • Application Fees: Rs 3,000 (General/OBC), Rs 2,400 (SC/ST/EWS), free for Persons with Disabilities.
"Selected candidates will undergo further evaluations for role-specific competencies."

This recruitment initiative by AIIMS aims to fill crucial positions across various locations in India, enhancing the healthcare workforce.
newTitle: AIIMS Announces Recruitment for Over 4000 Non-Faculty Positions Across India

title: From Assam, a rathole miner’s tale of survival: ‘Men scrambled out of tunnels and were swept into each other’ - The Indian Express
summary:
From Assam, a rathole miner’s tale of survival: ‘Men scrambled out of tunnels and were swept into each other’

Date: January 10, 2025 Source: The Indian Express

In a desperate incident, miners at the 3-Kilo Coal Quarry in Umrangso found themselves trapped due to a sudden influx of water, leading to a tragic scramble for survival.

  • Rajeev Barman entered the mine at 4:30 am seeking work.
  • Previous work at the site had been suspended due to water accumulation.
  • Survivors were pulled out from tunnels amid a chaotic evacuation.
“Men scrambled out of tunnels and were swept into each other.”

This incident highlights the perilous conditions faced by miners and the urgent need for safety regulations in hazardous work environments.
newTitle: From Assam, a rathole miner’s tale of survival: ‘Men scrambled out of tunnels and were swept into each other’
